tripleplay.util

Class SimpleFrames

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.util.SimpleFrames
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Frames

    public class SimpleFrames
extends Object
implements Frames
    A simple implementation of Frames that uses an untrimmed horizontal strip image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleFrames(Image source, float width)
      Creates an instance with the supplied source image.

      Creates an instance with the supplied source image.

      Creates an instance with the supplied source image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleFrames

        public SimpleFrames(Image source,
            float width)
        Creates an instance with the supplied source image. The frames are assumed to be all in a single row, thus the height of the image defines the height of the frame.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of each frame.

      • SimpleFrames

        public SimpleFrames(Image source,
            float width,
            float height)
        Creates an instance with the supplied source image. The image is assumed to contain a complete sheet of frames, each width x height in size.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of each frame.
        height - the width of each frame.

      • SimpleFrames

        public SimpleFrames(Image source,
            float width,
            float height,
            int count)
        Creates an instance with the supplied source image. The image is assumed to contain count frames, each width x height in size, in row major order (any missing frames are on the right side of the bottom row).
        Parameters:
        width - the width of each frame.
        height - the width of each frame.

        public void apply(int index,
         ImageLayer layer)
        Description copied from interface: Frames
        Configures the supplied image layer with the specified frame. The layer's image will be updated and the layer's translation will be adjusted to the requested frame's offset
